Portal ist ein First-Person Puzzle Spiel.
Innerhalb des Spiels durchlÃ¤uft man als Testperson die Forschungseinrichtung Aperture Science Enrichment Center. Dabei muss man mithilfe der Portal gun einen Hindernisparcour schaffen. 
Vom Gameplay her ist das Spiel beeindruckend und der Moment, bei dem man zum ersten Mal durch ein Portal geht, ist Verwirrend und Faszinierend zugleich. Mithilfe der Portal gun kann man zwei Portale erzeugen (ein oranges und ein blaues) und wenn man durch eines durchlÃ¤uft, dann kommt man direkt aus dem anderen wieder heraus. Die Tatsache, dass man selbst die Position der Portale bestimmen kann, erÃ¶ffnet viele MÃ¶glichkeiten an das Ziel zu gelangen. Aus physikalischer Sicht macht das Gameplay Sinn (wenn man z.B. mit einer hohen Geschwindigkeit in das blaue Portal rein springt, dann fliegt man impulsartig aus dem orangen Portal raus).
Die Grafik ist simpel und es wird eine sterile  AtmosphÃ¤re erzeugt, so wie man es von einer Forschungseinrichtung erwartet.

Portal es un juego de puzzles con una mecÃ¡nica original e intuitiva que te mete en la piel de Chell, una sujeto de pruebas de los laboratorios de Aperture Science. Debemos avanzar sala tras sala resolviendo los rompecabezas que se nos presentarÃ¡n usando la pistola de portales.
El juego estÃ¡ repleto de humor un tanto macabro desde el principio gracias a la antagonista, GLaDOS, una inteligencia artificial diseÃ±ada para controlar y vigilar AS.
El juego es breve, pero prÃ¡cticamente perfecto.

Portal est un jeu d'aventure/Ã©nigme, sortie et dÃ©velopper par Valve et sorti en 2007. Le jeu se situe dans l'univers crÃ©e par Valve a partir du premier Half Life. Il est donc liÃ©e Ã  l'univers de ce dernier et partage la temporalitÃ© et l'histoire de celui-ci.

Le jeu est a la premiÃ©re personne. Vous y incarnez un personnage sujet a des test dans un mystÃ©rieu laboratoire controler par l'intÃ©lligence artificielle GLADOS. Vous devrez a l'aide du portal gun, vous faufiler a travers toute les Ã©nigmes du jeu. Jusqu'Ã  affronter GLADOS elle mÃªme dans un combat mÃ©morable.

Ce premier Ã©pisode de portal est clairement une mise en bouche du second volume. En effet, si Ã  son Ã©poque le jeu devait dÃ©jÃ  Ãªtre un grand jeu. On ne peut manifestement pas dire le contraire aujourd'hui! Des Ã©nigmes aussi tordus que passionantes, une histoire et un univers riche Ã  dÃ©couvrir par vous mÃªme et une certaine touche d'humour noir qui ne vous laissera pas indifÃ©rent. L'histoire de Portal est bonne, il faut cependant Ãªtre attentif au dÃ©tails laisser par les dÃ©vellopeurs afin de la comprendre. Car plus que un simple jeu d'Ã©nigme Portal est aussi un jeu d'aventure et d'enquÃ©te, dans lequel vous aurez hÃ¢te de dÃ©couvrir les moindres recoins de cette univers.

Cependant ce premier volume n'est pas sans dÃ©fauts. Comme dis prÃ©cÃ©dement, il est clairement une mise en bouche pour le second volet. Notamment a cause de sa durÃ©e de vie trÃ©s courte (environ 2/3 heures). Profitez donc des soldes afin de vous munir du jeu, qui est nÃ©anmoins nÃ©cÃ©ssaire afin de comprendre portal 2 et l'univers de Valve.

En bref un trÃ©s grands jeu et un indispensable dans la suite de Half Life. Mais avant tout une mise en bouche immense avant le second volet.

[table]
[tr]
	[th]Title[/th]
	[th]Description[/th]
	[th]Rating[/th]
[/tr]
[tr]
	[td]Overall[/td]
	[td]This game is the best puzzle game I have ever played. It's worth the current $0.99 and it's worth the full price of $9.99.[/td]
	[td]10/10[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
	[td]Gameplay[/td]
	[td]The gameplay is all about portals. You usually use the portals to cross to another part of the room. Sometimes this is very simple, and sometimes it's not.[/td]
	[td]9/10[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
	[td]Combat[/td]
	[td]There isn't any combat in this game, only puzzles. Even the enemies you encounter your don't really fight, you outsmart them.[/td]
	[td]0/0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
	[td]Story / Side Quests[/td]
	[td]There isn't much of a story here, but what is there is great. It really leaves you wanting more story.[/td]
	[td]9/10[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
	[td]Graphics[/td]
	[td]For the age, the graphics are surprisingly good. You can still see the texture detail despite it's age. The graphics have definitely have aged well.[/td]
	[td]8/10[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
	[td]Controls[/td]
	[td]The controls are pretty simple but very well done and implemented. There isn't much else to say really.[/td]
	[td]8/10[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
	[td]UI[/td]
	[td]The UI is very plain, but it doesn't take away from the experience. In my opinion, it is a nice change from the usual overly complicated UI in modern games. The mouse support is very good. You can tell that it was made for the PC by this alone.[/td]
	[td]8/10[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
	[td]Difficulty[/td]
	[td]The difficulty is good for a puzzle game. It is just hard enough to keep you thinking but just easy enough that you don't get frustrated. It's in that perfect spot that every puzzle game aims for.[/td]
	[td]8/10[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
	[td]Technical / Bugs[/td]
	[td]I had no technical issues or bugs at all.[/td]
	[td]10/10[/td]
[/tr]
[/table]

Was a ton of fun to play. It's an icon of modern gaming and not much needs to be said about it as everyone has already said all there really is to say.

However, I don't know if its the newer hardware or some sort of update to the game, but the step count on my game overly counts steps vs other gameplay footage I've seen where the exact same move is performed. Portal jumps counting on steps where I watch videos of other's gameplay where it didn't. Not sure what's going on, but its ruined any chance of a perfect game (achievements). Kinda sad.

[h1]You get your moneys worth[/h1]
To put this in simple terms the game was cheap and so was the gameplay 
after a while you get bored of the same 19 puzzles and easy boss ending
[b]Pros of buying[/b]
    [*]Interesting thought process and creativeness put into the game itself (with the portals and puzzles and all)
    [*]Thrilling (towards the tests with the sentry turrets and killing the robot thing in the end)
    [*]Momentum of falling and being launched is so much fun
[/list]

[b]Cons of buying[/b]
[list]
    [*]A bit to easy (may be for me because i'm good at puzzles) also kind of repetitve
    [*]Poor Graphics and sound effects (yes yes i know, it was made quite a bit ago)
    [*]Not alot of actual story in the game (No backround lore no introduction to the character you play as, and most certainly not even a name to the robot that is keeping you here.)
[/list]

All around i would say this game is worth what i paid for it, ninety-nine cents. But considering the price i would 
recommend giving it a go, p.s. i had never played the game before but ofcourse every gamer that lives under a rock with 
the rest of us (hahaha-awe D:) knows about portal and its franchise and without even playing a minute know the whole story line. As a first timer for this game i'd say it was pretty chill and definately makes you feel satisfied once you beat each level.

This game points towards easy ways to solve puzzles, which will eventually help you in the later stages of the game which requires all the portal and game mechanics you learn along the way. This alone hints at the genius of the portal team with their progression as the player learns while playing.

10/10 would recommend for anybody looking for a good time, an interesting story, or simple fun.

Portal es un juego de puzzles en primera persona, y estos serÃ¡n resueltos gracias a nuestro ingenio y nuestra querida "portal-gun".

El juego en sÃ­ no es muy complejo, tiene 19 niveles mÃ¡s el final, y cada vez los puzzles son mÃ¡s difÃ­ciles y mÃ¡s largos. Al principio empezaremos sin nada, y deberemos avanzar esperando a que se generen los portales solos, mÃ¡s adelante recogeremos la portal-gun, pero estarÃ¡ incompleta y solo tendremos el portal azul. Al poco recibiremos la mejora para poder disparar el portal naranja, y con esto ya tenemos nuestro set para superar todos los puzzles siguientes.

No hay mucho misterio, entras por el portal azul y sales por el naranja y a la inversa, pero gracias a que el juego tiene fÃ­sicas, juega bastante con este tema, y algunos puzzles resultarÃ¡n interesantes.

En sÃ­, la historia tampoco es muy compleja, somos una especie de cobaya de un sistema informÃ¡tico de un centro llamado Aperture Science. Tendremos que seguir sus instrucciones a lo largo de todo el recorrido e ir resolviendo los puzzles que nos plantee. Este sistema informÃ¡tico, llamado GLaDOS tiene muy buenos toques de humor, y es un personaje que es considerado de los mejores en esta indÃºstria, tiene un hÃºmor un tanto peculiar y que te gusta pero odias a la vez, solo lo puedes entender si lo juegas.

El juego no tiene mucha duraciÃ³n (a mÃ­ me durÃ³ 2 horas), pero es interesante y es uno de los grandes pilares de la empresa Valve, asÃ­ que no estÃ¡ de mÃ¡s darle una oportunidad. Normalmente en ofertas te lo sueles encontrar por un precio de 0,99â‚¬, y es el tÃ­pico clÃ¡sico aquÃ­ en Steam que todo el mundo deberÃ­a jugar.

A parte despuÃ©s de toda la campaÃ±a, tienes unos niveles extra con puzzles realmente difÃ­ciles y desafios que deberÃ¡s realizar en un tiempo determinado.

Totalmente recomendable... ah, y un apunte, la canciÃ³n de los crÃ©ditos no tiene desperdicio.
